events.originalText: The impactor of the NASA space probe Deep Impact collided with the comet Tempel 1, excavating interior material to study its composition.
events.subtitle: NASA
events.headline: NASA's Deep Impact probe collides with comet Tempel 1

events.originalText: Kylie Minogue's first album, Kylie, was released, and went on to top the charts in the UK and New Zealand.
events.subtitle: Kylie Minogue
events.headline: Kylie Minogue's debut album 'Kylie' tops UK and New Zealand charts

events.originalText: Four Iranian diplomats were kidnapped after they were stopped at a checkpoint in northern Lebanon by Lebanese Phalange forces; their fates remain unknown.
events.subtitle: 1982 kidnapping of Iranian diplomats
events.headline: Four Iranian diplomats kidnapped in Lebanon by Phalange forces

events.originalText: Israeli forces raided Uganda's Entebbe International Airport to free hostages taken by hijackers on Air France Flight 139.
events.subtitle: Israel Defense Forces
events.headline: Israeli forces raid Uganda's Entebbe Airport to free hostages

events.originalText: The first Annual Reminder, a series of pickets that were some of the earliest LGBT actions in the United States, took place at Independence Hall in Philadelphia.
events.subtitle: Annual Reminder
events.headline: First Annual Reminder pickets for LGBT rights held in Philadelphia

events.originalText: In what is known as "The Miracle of Bern", West Germany defeated Hungary 3–2 to win the FIFA World Cup.
events.subtitle: 1954 FIFA World Cup final
events.headline: West Germany wins FIFA World Cup in 'The Miracle of Bern'

events.originalText: Four CIA officers arrived in Guatemala to begin Operation PBHistory in an attempt to justify the United States' overthrow of President Jacobo Árbenz one week prior.
events.subtitle: Central Intelligence Agency
events.headline: CIA officers arrive in Guatemala for Operation PBHistory

events.originalText: William Shockley announced the invention of the junction transistor, for which he, John Bardeen, and Walter Houser Brattain later won the Nobel Prize in Physics.
events.subtitle: William Shockley
events.headline: William Shockley announces invention of junction transistor

events.originalText: The United States' anti-communist propaganda source Radio Free Europe made its first broadcast aimed at Czechoslovakia.
events.subtitle: Anti-communism
events.headline: Radio Free Europe broadcasts anti-communist message to Czechoslovakia

events.originalText: The Brazilian cruiser Bahia (pictured) was accidentally sunk by one of its own crewmen, killing more than 300 people.
events.subtitle: Brazilian cruiser Bahia
events.headline: Brazilian cruiser Bahia accidentally sunk, over 300 killed

events.originalText: The aircraft carrying Władysław Sikorski, prime minister of the Polish government-in-exile, crashed off Gibraltar, killing him and fifteen others and leading to several conspiracy theories.
events.subtitle: Władysław Sikorski
events.headline: Polish Prime Minister Sikorski killed in Gibraltar plane crash

events.originalText: German AB-Aktion in Poland: After capturing Lwów, the Nazis executed professors of the University of Lwów along with their families.
events.subtitle: German AB-Aktion in Poland
events.headline: Nazis execute professors of University of Lwów in AB-Aktion

events.originalText: The Holocaust: During the German occupation of Latvia, a number of synagogues in Riga were set on fire, killing many Jews who were confined within.
events.subtitle: The Holocaust
events.headline: Synagogues in Riga set on fire during German occupation, many Jews killed

events.originalText: World War I: Allied forces led by the Australian general John Monash won the Battle of Hamel, demonstrating the effectiveness of combined-arms techniques in trench warfare.
events.subtitle: World War I
events.headline: Allied forces led by Australian general win Battle of Hamel in WWI

events.originalText: American Civil War: Confederate forces failed in an attempt to recapture the Union-occupied Helena, Arkansas.
events.subtitle: American Civil War
events.headline: Confederate forces fail to recapture Helena, Arkansas in Civil War

events.originalText: In a boat on the River Thames from Oxford to Godstow, author Lewis Carroll told Alice Liddell (pictured) and her sisters a story that later formed the basis for his book Alice's Adventures in Wonderland.
events.subtitle: River Thames
events.headline: Lewis Carroll tells story to Alice Liddell, inspiring 'Alice's Adventures in Wonderland'

events.originalText: The first edition of Walt Whitman's Leaves of Grass was published, and it went on to become one of the most important collections of American poetry.
events.subtitle: Walt Whitman
events.headline: First edition of Walt Whitman's 'Leaves of Grass' published

events.originalText: The Grand Junction Railway, the world's first long-distance railway with steam traction, opened between Birmingham and Newton Junction.
events.subtitle: Grand Junction Railway
events.headline: Grand Junction Railway opens between Birmingham and Newton Junction

events.originalText: In Philadelphia, the Continental Congress adopted the Declaration of Independence, announcing that the thirteen American colonies were no longer a part of the British Empire.
events.subtitle: Second Continental Congress
events.headline: Continental Congress adopts Declaration of Independence in Philadelphia

events.originalText: First English Civil War: Royalist forces defeated the Parliamentarians at the Battle of Burton Bridge, securing a crossing of the River Trent for a convoy of supplies travelling with Queen Henrietta Maria.
events.subtitle: First English Civil War
events.headline: Royalists defeat Parliamentarians at Battle of Burton Bridge in English Civil War

events.originalText: Chinese astronomers recorded the sudden appearance of a "guest star", later identified as the supernova that created the Crab Nebula.
events.subtitle: Chinese astronomy
events.headline: Chinese astronomers record supernova creating Crab Nebula

events.originalText: Chinese astronomers recorded the sudden appearance of a "guest star", later identified as the supernova that created the Crab Nebula.
events.subtitle: Chinese astronomy
events.headline: Chinese astronomers record supernova creating Crab Nebula

events.originalText: Byzantine emperor Theodosius II proclaimed his older sister Aelia Pulcheria as Augusta.
events.subtitle: Theodosius II
events.headline: Byzantine emperor Theodosius II proclaims sister Aelia Pulcheria as Augusta
